items.content_html: MicroLib is the first (and only) framework for Federated Microservices. It's a lightweight API framework built on Node.js that uses module federation to host and integrate multiple, independently deployable "microservice libraries" running in the same process. The idea is to eliminate or ameliorate the "microservices premium" and the trade-off between deployment independence and operational complexity.
items.title: module-federation/MicroLib: MicroLib is the first (and only) framework for Federated Microservices. It's a lightweight API framework built on Node.js that uses module federation to host and integrate multiple, independently deployable "microservice libraries" running in the same process.  The idea is to eliminate or ameliorate  the "microservices premium" and the trade-off between deployment independence and operational complexity.

items.content_html: üìã Angular Material & RxJS Observables are used to display my data. A Google Cloud Firestore NoSQL database stores the blog posts & Contact Form data. Anyone can read the blog posts. Angularfire-lite was used as a Firebase API wrapper as it is simple and lightweight, reducing Vendor bundle size & improving the Chrome Lighthouse score.
items.title: AndrewJBateman/angular-material-portfolio: :clipboard:  Angular Material & RxJS Observables are used to display my data. A Google Cloud Firestore NoSQL database stores the blog posts & Contact Form data. Anyone can read the blog posts. Angularfire-lite was used as a Firebase API wrapper as it is simple and lightweight, reducing Vendor bundle size & improving the Chrome Lighthouse score.
